data.title: Ed & Joe's, a family pizza anchor for Tinley
data.text: We've been here many times with the family. It's not only a great family pizza place, it serves as a Tinley landmark in the center of town. It's century-old building is a delight, and their live music and events are community builders. A civic institution with great food too!

data.title: Pizza!!!!
data.text:
Love this place.The pizza is well known in The Tinley area.Especially the Taco Pizza.!
It's a great family place.Some nights they even have live entertainment.They also have characters for the kiddies l( like Elmo,Clifford etc.)There is sometimes a wait.But well worth waiting for.Right in the heart of Downtown Tinley .There is usually something always going on in that area.

data.title: My absolutely favorite pizza place.
data.text: When I want pizza, Ed & Joe's is where I go. We celebrated my birthday last Friday with friends.  My one friend can't eat gluten. Ed & Joes now has a gluten free pizza. She said it was very good. I love good Italian sausage and E&J's has it. They also have a BBQ chicken, and a taco pizza. All of them are excellent. They may have deep dish, but thats a 1950's North side invention and I would never order such a travesty.

data.title: Favorite local restaurant
data.text: Whenever we aren't sure what to eat we end up at Ed & Joe's. They have great pizza but they also have great dinners and burgers. We don't live far and get delivery from them on a regular basis.

data.title: Great thin crust pizza
data.text: Thin crust pizza is tops.  Lake perch sandwich also a winner.  Many selections of Italian foods and sandwiches.

data.title: Strange smell
data.text: Went in for the first time and we ordered the chicken lemon, and a steak sandwich.  Very musty smell...like an old home's basement....The chicken was nothing to brag about...below avg in taste...will not revisit again.

data.title: Too noisy for starters!
data.text:
Went there the other day with another couple.  Out of 4 of us, only one enjoyed their meal.The other 3 were unimpressed.  The pasta with vodka sauce and sausage was
good.  One person had a pasta special and the others split a taco pizza.  It wasn't worth
the money.  We will not be returning.

data.title: Amazing everytime!!
data.text: I have ate here about 4 times while visiting Tinley. Usually sit at the bar when Jake is bartending. What a great bartender! Pizza is always amazing! Highly recommend!!

data.title: Great Pizza
data.text:
A group I belong to had a meeting here last night. This place is great. They gave us a private room that comfortably held our whole group. The menu is pretty large and offers a wide range of choices and our members ordered a wide range of items. I had pizza and it was so good. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meal. It was a very hot day and the server provided a never ending supply of ice cold water. 
The server, Ashley, was amazing. She handled our big group with ease and always a smile on her face. She somehow paced everything perfectly. She gave us time to convene our meeting, do a little business and then took our orders. Everything just fell into place and she provided separate checks which is unusual for such a big group. Ashley is a gem and if she's working you'd be wise to request her as your server. 
Overall this is a good place with wonderful food. I know I'll go back with my family.

data.title: In the mood for pizza
data.text: I found this place close to my hotel. The location was nice. It looked like the businesses have kept the area up nice. I did find it difficult to find a parking spot. The staff was friendly when I arrived. I got a nice window seat so I watched the outside while I waited. I ordered a hamburger and pepperoni and got a ham and pepperoni instead. I asked the waitress about it and she apologized and offered to get me another pizza. I just kept it and tried it .The outside of the pizza was ok but as I got closer to the middle it was extremely greasy and salty. I like pizza alot but this one I'm not a fan of. I can't say I'd come back or recommend it but I can say I tried it. I'm still looking for a Chicago style pizza that I like.

data.title: Good Pizza and Friendly Setting
data.text:
Very good pizza, friendly staff and kids find trains going by entertaining!
Great place for families or to meet friends in a casual setting.
Music some nights, also.

data.title: Great thin crust pizza
data.text: Excellent thin crust pizza  try the taco pizza if you want something unique!!  Good music on the weekends!!  Fun downtown tinley pizza place!!

data.title: Dirty
data.text: At one time this was a decent pizza place but it has slipped. Dirty needs some TLC. Numerous other places in the area to visit

data.title: 2016 Restaurant Review
data.text:
This restaurant I classify as a family pizza place on Friday or Saturday dinner times.

Excellent thin crust pizza. Order on the large to family size. Service is good, when busy - order and appetizer and drinks. Sometimes and additional 10 to 15 min wait on pizza.

Sandwiches, fish good.

Prices reasonable.

JP

data.title: Best Taco Pizza
data.text: Either you eat in the place or at home. Hands down, they have the BEST taco pizza around!!  I have tried other places and you cant beat them!!   The other items on their menu are also good!

data.title: Quick Dinner.
data.text:
I think my timing was off, the place was crowed there was a small band setting up.
Had a 20 min wait for a table, when the food came it was good.
When the band started it got very loud couldn't even talk due to the band being so loud.

data.title: Good food and atmosphere
data.text: My first experience at Ed & Joe's was great. We went on a Saturday night and it was busy but not too overcrowded. We had our small kids with us, and I was happy to see a good mix of couples and families in this restaurant. Our food and service were very good. We will definitely be returning.

data.title: A favorite local spot!
data.text:
Ed & Joe's is well known for its pizza, and it is great thin crust pie, but its sandwiches and pasta are well above average.  Their burgers, chicken sandwiches and wraps, are big and delicious!  Their tortellini soup is a meal in itself and crazy good.  Salads are good but ask for extra dressing.  The pizza is first rate, and the taco pizza is something you don't find anywhere else in the area.

Service can be a bit slow, and it is noisy, but the overall experience is worth it.  Also, this is a great place to bring children.

data.title: Favorite of the locals
data.text: Good family atmosphere. Slightly loud . Service can be slow. appetizers are good. Gourmet pizza is a bit pricey but well worth the price. I especially love the Sinatra, garlic, spinach, gourmet cheese.

data.title: The Ultimate Pizza!
data.text: When we moved to Tinley Park, I was 33 years old. This year I'm working on being a 78 year old.  In all these years I've always held Ed & Joe's to the highest honor of being the best pizza I've ever had, and believe me, at this age I've had quite a few!  Their thin crust is truly unique, the sausage is wonderful, the sauce is not too much-not too little and just the right sweetness to acidity.  It's nice and cheesy too, real cheese, not the rubbery stuff you can find on a lot of pizzas.  I always get the sausage and cheese pizza, but I'm sure that any added ingredients would probably be wonderful as well.  I now live in the northern suburbs by Wisconsin and on special occasions will make the one hour trip back to Tinley Park just to go visit my favorite Ed & Joe's. I'll bring back extra pizza to freeze too.  Yes, it's that good!  My children  remember it well from growing up as it was always our Saturday night dinner treat.  What a legacy Ed & Joe's has for all the wonderful memories it's left us.  I hope they never change.
